questions.question: How many bones are in the adult human body?
questions.funFact: Babies are born with about 270 bones, but many fuse together as we grow.

questions.question: How tall is the Statue of Liberty from base to torch tip?
questions.funFact: The statue was a gift from France and was dedicated in 1886.

questions.question: How many miles is the Earth from the Moon on average?
questions.funFact: You could fit all the other planets in our solar system in the gap between Earth and the Moon.

questions.question: How many keys are on a standard piano?
questions.funFact: The piano has 52 white keys and 36 black keys, spanning over 7 octaves.

questions.question: How many countries are there in the world (UN member states)?
questions.funFact: The newest UN member state is South Sudan, which joined in 2011.

questions.question: How long is the Great Wall of China in miles?
questions.funFact: The wall was built over many centuries, with the most well-known sections dating to the Ming Dynasty.

questions.question: How many dimples are on a standard golf ball?
questions.funFact: The dimples help reduce drag and allow the ball to fly farther through the air.

questions.question: What is the speed of sound in miles per hour at sea level?
questions.funFact: Chuck Yeager was the first person to break the sound barrier in 1947.

questions.question: How many words are in the average adult's vocabulary?
questions.funFact: We typically use only about 3,000 words in daily conversation.

questions.question: How many times does the average human heart beat per day?
questions.funFact: Over a lifetime, the heart beats about 2.5 billion times without ever stopping to rest.

questions.question: How many islands make up the Hawaiian archipelago?
questions.funFact: Only 8 of Hawaii's islands are considered main islands, and only 7 are permanently inhabited.

questions.question: How many calories are in a pound of body fat?
questions.funFact: This classic estimate has been used in diet advice for decades.

questions.question: How many feet tall is the Eiffel Tower (to the top)?
questions.funFact: When it was built in 1889, the Eiffel Tower was the tallest man-made structure in the world.

questions.question: How many pages are in the first Harry Potter book?
questions.funFact: J.K. Rowling's manuscript was rejected by 12 publishers before Bloomsbury accepted it in 1997.

questions.question: How many muscles are in the human body?
questions.funFact: The smallest muscle is in your ear (the stapedius), and the largest is the gluteus maximus.
